cyclone.name: HERMINE
cyclone.current_location: about 170 mi WSW of Key West, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: expected to turn WNW tonight, then NW Tuesday, bend N and NE to cross Florida’s Big-Bend coast Thursday and lift NE just off the GA/SC/NC coasts into the Atlantic toward the mid-Atlantic waters
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend coast near Cedar Key

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Big Bend, then coastal GA/SC/NC before moving offshore of the mid-Atlantic
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (<5%) of 34-kt winds late Fri–Sat; most likely gusts 25-35 mph
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected along the Virginia port area with present forecast track
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rain bands could bring 1–2 inches of rain late Fri into Sat
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents possible along Virginia beaches as the system passes offshore
